intro: Kyllinga monocephala var. leiolepis, commonly known as the broadleaf spikerush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are often reddish in color. It thrives in wet or marshy environments, often forming dense stands in wetlands. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
